metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Vue v-on Directive
Like event handling in plain JavaScript, the v-on directive in Vue tells the browser:
content.html: Like event handling in plain JavaScript, the v-on directive in Vue tells the browser:

content.text: Examples using v-on
Let's take a look at some examples to see how v-on can be used with different events and different code to run when these events occur.
content.html: Let's take a look at some examples to see how v-on can be used with different events and different code to run when these events occur.

content.text: Note: To run more advanced code when an event occurs we need to introduce Vue methods. Learn about Vue methods on the next page in this tutorial.
content.html: Note: To run more advanced code when an event occurs we need to introduce Vue methods. Learn about Vue methods on the next page in this tutorial.

content.text: onclick Event
The v-on directive allows us to perform actions based on specified events.
content.html: The v-on directive allows us to perform actions based on specified events.

content.text: Use v-on:click to perform action when the element is clicked.
content.html: Use v-on:click to perform action when the element is clicked.

content.code_html:
<div id="app">
  <div id="lightDiv">
    <div v-show="lightOn"></div>
    <img src="img_lightBulb.svg">
  </div>
  <button v-on:click="lightOn = !lightOn">Switch light</button>
</div>

<script src="https://unpkg.com/vue@3/dist/vue.global.js"></script>
<script>
  const app = Vue.createApp({
    data() {
      return {
        lightOn: false
      }
    }
  })
  app.mount('#app')
</script>

content.text: oninput Event
Use v-on:input to perform action when the element gets an input, like a keystroke inside a text field.
content.html: Use v-on:input to perform action when the element gets an input, like a keystroke inside a text field.

content.code: {{ 'Input events occured: ' + inpCount }}
content.code_html:
<div id="app">
  <input v-on:input="inpCount++">
  <p>{{ 'Input events occured: ' + inpCount }}</p>
</div>

<script src="https://unpkg.com/vue@3/dist/vue.global.js"></script>
<script>
  const app = Vue.createApp({
    data() {
      return {
        inpCount: 0
      }
    }
  })
  app.mount('#app')
</script>

content.text: mousemove Event
Use v-on:mousemove to perform action when the mouse pointer moves over an element.
content.html: Use v-on:mousemove to perform action when the mouse pointer moves over an element.

content.code: Move the mouse pointer over the box below
content.code_html:
<div id="app">
  <p>Move the mouse pointer over the box below</p>
  <div v-on:mousemove="colorVal=Math.floor(Math.random()*360)"
       v-bind:style="{backgroundColor:'hsl('+colorVal+',80%,80%)'}">
  </div>
</div>

<script src="https://unpkg.com/vue@3/dist/vue.global.js"></script>
<script>
  const app = Vue.createApp({
    data() {
      return {
        colorVal: 50
      }
    }
  })
  app.mount('#app')
</script>

content.text: Use v-on in a v-for Loop
You can also use the v-on directive inside a v-for loop.
content.html: You can also use the v-on directive inside a v-for loop.

content.text: The items of the array are available for each iteration inside the v-on value.
content.html: The items of the array are available for each iteration inside the v-on value.

content.code: 1. {{ food.name }}
content.code_html:
<div id="app">
  <img v-bind:src="imgUrl">
  <ol>
    <li v-for="food in manyFoods" v-on:click="imgUrl=food.url">
      {{ food.name }}
    </li>
  </ol>
</div>

<script src="https://unpkg.com/vue@3/dist/vue.global.js"></script>
<script>
  const app = Vue.createApp({
    data() {
      return {
        imgUrl: 'img_salad.svg',
        manyFoods: [
          {name: 'Burrito', url: 'img_burrito.svg'},
          {name: 'Salad', url: 'img_salad.svg'},
          {name: 'Cake', url: 'img_cake.svg'},
          {name: 'Soup', url: 'img_soup.svg'}
        ]
      }
    }
  })
  app.mount('#app')
</script>

content.text: Shorthand for v-on
The shorthand for ' v-on ' is simply ' @ '.

content.code_html: <button @:click="lightOn = !lightOn">Switch light</button>

content.text: We will start using @ syntax a little later in this tutorial.
content.html: We will start using @ syntax a little later in this tutorial.

content.text: Vue Exercises
Test Yourself With Exercises
Exercise:
Complete the code so that the image toggles when the button is clicked.
content.html: Complete the code so that the image toggles when the button is clicked.

content.code_html:
<template>
  <button ="showImg = !showImg">
    Toggle image
  </button>
  <img src="flower.jpg" alt="flower" v-show="showImg">
</template>

<script>
  export default {
    data() {
      return {
        : true
      }
    }
  }
</script>

content.text: Start the Exercise
